Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched a strong game, allowing only one run in six scoreless innings
Teoscar Hernández hit a two-run homer in the third inning
Juan Soto tied the game at 1-1 with a solo shot to right field off Yamamoto
Freddie Freeman and Mookie Betts contributed to the Dodgers' offense
Pre-Game Insights: Aaron Judge came to New York to do one thing: bring the Yankees a World Series title for the first time since 2009
Freddie Freeman told Ken Rosenthal that his walk-off grand slam to win Game 1 still hasn't settled with him
Yankees manager Aaron Boone feels 'convicted' after choosing to close Game 1 with LHP Nestor Cortes
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers survived and take a commanding 2-0 lead to the Bronx
Aaron Judge is now 1-for-9 with six strikeouts in the World Series
The Yankees loaded the bases, putting the winning run on base, but the Dodgers survived
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Dodger Stadium with a crowd of 52,725
The Dodgers' Yoshinobu Yamamoto was sharp as the starter, allowing only one run
The Yankees' Carlos Rodón was taken off after allowing three runs in the third inning
Others: The article provides live updates and analysis of Game 2 of the World Series between the Yankees and the Dodgers
